title: Practice-Centered Language Leadership Workshop for Strengthening Educational Leader Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Targeting current professionals (medical/legal/technical fields), foundational educational leadership understanding, and basic communication skills in multicultural environments
context.additional_context: A case study on language domain applications in smartphone-based learning environments, integrating language learning elements such as text analysis, vocabulary expansion, and expression refinement. Emphasis on effective communication strategies within the context of educational leadership.

learning_goals: Improving the ability to make culturally contextualized leadership decisions by analyzing problem cases from real educational settings.

Over one week, learners analyze three simulation-based multicultural education scenarios, establish ≥2 conflict management strategies per scenario considering cultural differences, and achieve ≥80% suitability scores in peer evaluations and instructor feedback—particularly strategies reflecting linguistic expression, nonverbal communication, and cultural sensitivity differences.
Applying action research methodology to design learner-customized educational programs—integrating language acquisition theories and communication strategies.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
